org.lenskit.util.io

Class ObjectStreams

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lenskit.util.io.ObjectStreams

  • public final class ObjectStreams
extends java.lang.Object

    Utility methods for streams.

    Compatibility
    Public

    • Method Detail

      • wrap

        public static <T> ObjectStream<T> wrap(java.util.Iterator<? extends T> iterator)

        Wrap an iterator in an object stream.

        The iterator may not contain null. This property is checked lazily; the object stream will not fail until the null would be returned.

        Parameters:
        T - The type of data to return.
        iterator - An iterator to wrap
        Returns:
        An object stream returning the elements of the iterator.

      • wrap

        public static <T> ObjectStream<T> wrap(java.util.stream.Stream<? extends T> stream)

        Wrap a Java stream in an object stream.

        The stream may not contain null. This property is checked lazily; the object stream will not fail until the null would be returned.

        Parameters:
        T - The type of data to return.
        stream - A stream to wrap
        Returns:
        An object stream returning the elements of the stream.

      • wrap

        public static <T> ObjectStream<T> wrap(java.util.stream.Stream<? extends T> stream,
                                       @WillCloseWhenClosed
                                       java.io.Closeable root)

        Wrap a Java stream in an object stream.

        The stream may not contain null. This property is checked lazily; the object stream will not fail until the null would be returned.

        Parameters:
        T - The type of data to return.
        stream - A stream to wrap
        root - The ‘root stream’, which will be closed when the resulting stream is closed.
        Returns:
        An object stream returning the elements of the stream.

      • wrap

        public static <T> ObjectStream<T> wrap(java.util.Collection<? extends T> collection)

        Wrap a collection in an object stream.

        The iterator may not contain null. This property is checked lazily; the object stream will not fail until the null would be returned.

        Parameters:
        T - The type of data to return.
        collection - A collection to wrap
        Returns:
        An object stream returning the elements of the collection.

      • filter

        public static <T> ObjectStream<T> filter(@WillCloseWhenClosed
                                         ObjectStream<T> stream,
                                         Predicate<? super T> predicate)

        Filter an object stream.

        Parameters:
        T - The type of object stream rows.
        stream - The source stream.
        predicate - A predicate indicating which rows to return.
        Returns:
        An object stream returning all rows for which predicate returns true.

      • filter

        public static <T> ObjectStream<T> filter(@WillCloseWhenClosed
                                         ObjectStream<?> source,
                                         java.lang.Class<T> type)

        Filter an object stream to only contain elements of type type. Unlike filter(ObjectStream, Predicate) with a predicate from Predicates.instanceOf(Class), this method also transforms the stream to be of the target type.

        Parameters:
        T - The type of value in the stream.
        source - The source stream.
        type - The type to filter.
        Returns:
        An object stream returning all elements in stream which are instances of type type.

      • consume

        public static <T> ObjectStream<T> consume(int n,
                                          ObjectStream<T> stream)

        Consume and discard the first n elements from an object stream.

        Parameters:
        n - The number of elements to drop.
        stream - The stream.
        T - The stream’s element type.
        Returns:
        The passed-in stream, for convenience and functional-looking code. This method immediately consumes the elements, however, so stream is modified.

      • transform

        @Deprecated
public static <S,T> ObjectStream<T> transform(@WillCloseWhenClosed
                                                          ObjectStream<S> objectStream,
                                                          Function<? super S,? extends T> function)
        Deprecated. Use Stream.map(java.util.function.Function), possibly with wrap(Stream, Closeable).

        Transform an object stream’s values.

        Parameters:
        S - The type of source stream rows
        T - The type of output stream rows
        objectStream - The source stream
        function - A function to apply to each row in the stream. It will be applied to each value at most once.
        Returns:
        A new stream iterating the results of function.

      • empty

        public static <T> ObjectStream<T> empty()

        Create an empty object stream.

        Parameters:
        T - The type of value in the object stream.
        Returns:
        An empty object stream.

      • makeList

        @Deprecated
public static <T> java.util.List<T> makeList(@WillClose
                                                         ObjectStream<? extends T> objectStream)
        Deprecated. Use Stream.collect(Collector).

        Read an object stream into a list, closing when it is finished.

        Parameters:
        T - The type of item in the object stream.
        objectStream - The object stream.
        Returns:
        A new list containing the elements of the object stream.

      • count

        @Deprecated
public static int count(@WillClose
                                    ObjectStream<?> objectStream)
        Deprecated. Use Stream.collect(Collector).

        Count the items in a stream.

        Parameters:
        objectStream - The object stream.
        Returns:
        The number of items in the stream.

      • sort

        @Deprecated
public static <T> ObjectStream<T> sort(@WillClose
                                                   ObjectStream<T> objectStream,
                                                   java.util.Comparator<? super T> comp)
        Deprecated. Use Stream.sorted(Comparator), possibly with wrap(Stream, Closeable).

        Sort an object stream. This reads the original object stream into a list, sorts it, and returns a new object stream backed by the list (after closing the original object stream).

        Parameters:
        T - The type of value in the object stream.
        objectStream - The object stream to sort.
        comp - The comparator to use to sort the object stream.
        Returns:
        An object stream iterating over the sorted results.

      • of

        @SafeVarargs
public static <T> ObjectStream<T> of(T... contents)

        Create an object stream over a fixed set of elements. This is mostly useful for testing.

        Parameters:
        contents - The contents.
        T - The data type.
        Returns:
        The object stream.

      • concat

        public static <T> ObjectStream<T> concat(java.lang.Iterable<? extends ObjectStream<? extends T>> streams)

        Concatenate object streams. Each object stream is closed as closed as it is consumed.

        Parameters:
        streams - The object streams to concatenate.
        T - The type of data.
        Returns:
        The concatenated object stream.

      • concat

        @SafeVarargs
public static <T> ObjectStream<T> concat(ObjectStream<? extends T>... objectStreams)

        Concatenate object streams.

        See Also:
        concat(Iterable)
